author: Irina Anghel
description: UK households are struggling to save as more of their income is eaten up by the rapidly rising cost of food and other essentials, according to a closely watched survey.
title: Britons Are Saving Less as Cost of Living Surges, GfK Says

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: The UK and Irish governments are set to announce a new framework to deal with legacy issues from decades of sectarian violence in Northern Ireland known as ‘The Troubles,’ marking a step forward in Anglo-Irish relations.
title: UK, Ireland to Replace ‘Troubles’ Bill in Boost to Relations

author: Keith Laing
description: President Donald Trump’s choice to lead the nation’s top car safety regulator was cleared by the US Senate on Thursday, positioning him to take over federal probes including several high-profile investigations involving cars made by Tesla Inc.
title: Trump’s Auto Safety Chief Nominee Confirmed by US Lawmakers

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Mark Chediak
description: The Trump administration stoked fresh uncertainty about the future of an offshore wind farm near Massachusetts on Thursday, as it asked a federal court to send a key project permit back to the Interior Department for further review.
title: Trump Asks Court for Review of Wind Farm Off Nantucket

author: Oma Seddiq
description: A key Republican US senator demanded OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman hand over documents and information about the risks ChatGPT poses to children and teens, expanding a congressional probe into artificial intelligence chatbots.
title: OpenAI Probed Over Risks to Teen Safety After Senate Testimony

author: Josh Wingrove, Natalia Drozdiak
description: The call Friday between US President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping promises to determine the fate of TikTok — and potentially ease trade tensions between the world’s two biggest economies.
title: Trump, Xi to Hold Call as TikTok, Tariffs and Nvidia Loom Large

author: Lydia Beyoud, Nicola M White, Bernard Goyder
description: The White House is weighing additional candidates to chair the Commodity Futures Trading Commission as the confirmation process for Brian Quintenz to lead the regulator has stalled, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: White House Weighs More Candidates for CFTC as Nominee Stalls

author: Alex Wickham
description: The UK’s foreign intelligence service, MI6, launched a new online portal which it says will allow potential spies in Russia and elsewhere to send the agency messages securely over the dark web.
title: UK’s MI6 Agency Sets Up New Dark Web Portal to Recruit Spies

author: Jamie Tarabay
description: A key Democratic senator assailed Donald Trump and his intelligence chief, saying they were purging veteran officials, impugning evidence-based threat assessments and working to “systematically undermine” US spy agencies.
title: Key Democratic Senator Says Gabbard Weakening US Spy Agencies

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior White House correspondent Jennifer A. Dlouhy looks at how the president is trying to use energy supplies to pressure Russia on Ukraine. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Leans on Europe to Use Oil as Pressure Point on Putin

author: Thomas Seal
description: Canada withdrew challenges against some import taxes the US levied against softwood lumber in what the government called a “strategic choice,” as Prime Minister Mark Carney seeks a trade deal with President Donald Trump.
title: Canada Ends Fight Against Some US Lumber Duties, Seeking Wider Deal

author: Patricia Hurtado
description: A Bank of America Corp. unit will pay $5.56 million to resolve a US Department of Justice investigation into allegations that two former employees participated in market manipulation schemes.
title: BofA to Pay $5.56 Million to End DOJ Market Manipulation Case

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: Brendan Carr, the chairman of the US Federal Communications Commission, is attracting the kind of attention that’s rarely bestowed upon his position.
title: Who Is Brendan Carr? Meet the Regulator Behind Kimmel’s Removal

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US vetoed a resolution in the United Nations Security Council demanding an immediate ceasefire in the war in Gaza that was backed by all the other members of the body.
title: US Vetoes UN Resolution on Gaza Ceasefire

author: Arne Delfs, Daniel Basteiro
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said his government will make a decision in the next days about a European Union proposal to suspend Israel’s preferential trade benefits in response to the deteriorating humanitarian situation in Gaza.
title: Merz Says Germany Still to Decide on EU’s Israel Sanctions Plan

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: Republican Senator Bill Cassidy invited Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to speak with senators one day after the Senate health committee held a fiery hearing with the deposed head of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
title: Cassidy Invites RFK Jr. to Speak to Senators After CDC Hearing

author: Alister Bull
description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa moved to defuse tensions sparked by his warning that the African National Congress risks losing voter support unless it learns from a key political rival.
title: Ramaphosa Tries to Defuse Backlash After Praising Rival Party

author: Catherine Lucey, Kate Sullivan, Ellen Milligan
description: With golden carriages, military splendor and an opulent banquet, the UK’s royal gambit paid off this week, as President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Keir Starmer concluded an historic state visit by hailing the trans-Atlantic relationship and — at least publicly — smoothing over their policy differences.
title: Trump Flattery Pays Off for Starmer With Major Pitfalls Averted

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration is seeking to speed the development of power plants, power lines, and other energy projects that can help meet the mounting electricity demand from AI and manufacturing.
title: Trump Seeks to Speed Large Power Projects to Meet AI Demand

author: Zoe Tillman, Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump has asked the US Supreme Court to let him fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook while she fights his attempt to oust her, pulling the justices into a high-profile legal battle with major implications for the US central bank’s independence.
title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Let Him Fire Fed’s Lisa Cook

author: Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan
description: President Donald Trump said he doesn’t know the UK ambassador to Washington who was fired by Prime Minister Keir Starmer last week over his relationship with pedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein, despite meeting him in the Oval Office four months ago.
title: Trump Denies Knowing Mandelson After UK Envoy Axed Over Epstein

author: Ewa Krukowska, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is planning measures to accelerate the bloc’s phaseout of Russian liquefied natural gas, just days after US President Donald Trump called on the EU to do more to curb Moscow’s energy trade.
title: EU Plans to Phase Out Russian LNG More Quickly After Trump Call

author: Catherine Lucey, Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump defended ABC’s decision to suspend late-night host Jimmy Kimmel’s show indefinitely over remarks about the death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, suggesting the move was motivated by ratings and dismissing concerns about the implications for free speech.
title: Trump Says Kimmel Suspended For Bad Ratings Not Free Speech

author: Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump indicated he could further extend his trade truce with Chinese President Xi Jinping when the leaders speak on Friday, in addition to brokering a sale for TikTok’s US operations.
title: Trump Says May Extend China Truce Alongside TikTok Talks With Xi

author: Myles Miller
description: A Texas man has been arrested and charged with making anti-Muslim death threats against Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for New York City mayor and the front-runner in recent polls, authorities said.
title: Death Threats Against NYC Mayor Candidate Mamdani Lead to Arrest

author: Ellen Milligan, Alex Wickham
description: Donald Trump reaffirmed his opposition to a looming UK decision to recognize a Palestinian state, but the US president passed up the chance to personally urge Prime Minister Keir Starmer to reconsider the move.
title: Trump Says He Disagrees With Starmer Bid to Recognize Palestine

author: Kate Sullivan, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump said his administration is seeking to reclaim possession of Bagram, an air base in Afghanistan, that he has lambasted his predecessor for handing over during the US exit from that country.
title: Trump Says US Seeking Return of Bagram Air Base From Afghanistan

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said Russian President Vladimir Putin had “really let me down” after meeting with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer to discuss efforts to heighten pressure on Russia to enter negotiations that could help bring the Kremlin’s three-year war in Ukraine to an end.
title: Trump Says Putin ‘Let Me Down’ After Meeting Starmer on Ukraine

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: Federal Communications Commission Chairman Brendan Carr said Jimmy Kimmel’s comments about the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk “appeared to mislead the public about a significant fact.”
title: FCC Chairman Says Kimmel Comments Seemed to Mislead the Public

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Wall Street’s one-time “Junk Bond King” is opening a $500 million museum venerating American capitalism down the block from the Trump White House.
title: The Junk Bond King Opens a Shrine to Capitalism Near the White House

author: Ryan Vlastelica, Matt Turner
description: The US government’s bet on Intel Corp. is paying off in a big way after a surprise investment from Nvidia Corp. sparked the biggest rally in the chipmaker’s shares in nearly four decades.
title: US Government’s Intel Stake Worth $14 Billion After Nvidia Deal

author: Erik Larson
description: On Aug. 25, President Donald Trump moved to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook following a claim by a top administration official that she may have engaged in so-called mortgage occupancy fraud by falsely labeling a secondary home as her primary residence to get better loan terms.
title: What Is the Mortgage Fraud Lisa Cook Is Accused Of?

author: Kate Sullivan
description: President Donald Trump’s call with Chinese President Xi Jinping is slated to take place on Friday at 9 a.m. Washington time, according to a US official.
title: Trump, Xi Call Scheduled for 9am Washington Time on Friday

author: Simone Foxman, Caitlin Reilly, Gregory Korte
description: The Trump administration is making plans for how to go after left-wing groups it says are fomenting political violence following the killing of Charlie Kirk, while nonprofits prepare to defend themselves.
title: Trump Readies Tax, Criminal Crackdowns on Liberal Groups After Kirk Killing

author: Emily Birnbaum, Erik Wasson
description: Democratic lawmakers are calling for Federal Communications Commission Chair Brendan Carr to resign for a “corrupt abuse of power” after Walt Disney Co.’s ABC network announced it’s taking late-night host Jimmy Kimmel’s show off the air indefinitely.
title: Democrats Call on FCC Chair to Resign Over ABC’s Kimmel Decision

author: Ryan Gallagher
description: British authorities have charged two men over a cyberattack that disrupted London’s transport network for several weeks last year.
title: UK Police Charge Two in London Transport Hack That Lasted Weeks

author: Erik Wasson
description: Out-of-power Democrats have been unable to slow down the president’s agenda or even make headlines in Donald Trump’s Washington.
title: US Shutdown Risks Rise as Democrats Dig In on Health-Care Fixes

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett offered an endorsement of the Federal Reserve’s decision to cut interest rates by 25 basis points Wednesday, even after President Donald Trump and his allies had pressed for a bigger move.
title: Hassett Offers Endorsement of Fed Rate Cut, Says It’s a Start

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves said the UK government was looking at measures to reduce inflation when it publishes its next budget in November.
title: UK’s Reeves Tells BOE That Lowering Inflation Is Goal of Budget

author: Chris Anstey
description: Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers said Federal Reserve policy is leaning toward being too slack, emphasizing that the US economy’s biggest risks lie in inflation rather than the job market.
title: Summers Says Fed Policy ‘On the Loose Side,’ Inflation Top Issue

author: Lucy White
description: The UK government said it deported the first migrant to France under a new “one in, one out” deal, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer attempts to present a tough front on migration.
title: UK Deports First Migrant to France Under ‘One In, One Out’ Deal

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: The young man charged with the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk stared blankly into the camera from the Utah County Jail.
title: Horror of Kirk’s Death Gives Way to Tears, Shock at Murder Scene

author: Mathieu Dion, Alicia A. Caldwell, Paula Sambo
description: Canada is seeing a sharp increase in asylum-seekers entering through a border crossing between New York and the province of Quebec, as President Donald Trump’s policies drive away migrants and even some US citizens.
title: After ICE Raids, Canada Sees Surge in Migrants Crossing Border Through New York

author: Upmanyu Trivedi
description: UK counter terrorism police have arrested three people over allegations they assisted the Russian foreign intelligence service.
title: UK Police Arrest Three Over Russian Spying Allegations

author: Linh Vu Nguyen
description: A former senior parliamentary official has been sentenced to over five years in jail in a corruption case linked to a construction company accused of bribing its way into winning deals.
title: Vietnam Jails Ex-Parliament Official in Corruption Trial, Report Says

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is planning to present member states with its latest package of proposed sanctions on Russia as early as Friday, following a phone call between Ursula von der Leyen and US President Donald Trump, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Set to Propose New Russia Sanctions as Soon as This Week

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Two Russian oil refineries were attacked on Thursday as Ukraine stepped up strikes on its enemy’s energy infrastructure.
title: Ukraine Hits Two Russian Oil Refineries as Strikes Intensify

author: Brian Platt, Alex Vasquez
description: The leaders of Canada and Mexico will meet Thursday with the aim of bolstering their economic and security ties ahead of a contentious review of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement next year.
title: Carney and Sheinbaum Meet Without Trump Before Trade Deal Review

author: Jana Randow
description: The German economy probably returned to growth in the third quarter, bolstered by industrial demand, according to the Bundesbank.
title: German Growth Probably Resumed This Quarter, Bundesbank Says

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: Nationalist and populist forces in EU member states are on the rise.
title: One Crisis Too Many Takes Europe to the Brink

description: Donald Trump in Windsor Photographer: Kirsty Wigglesworth/Getty Images
title: Trump, Starmer Set for Day of Diplomacy

author: Rodrigo Orihuela
description: NATO’s investment fund NIF picked a Spanish startup for its first investment in satellite technology, a new step in Europe’s push to develop that industry in the continent.
title: NATO Fund Taps Spanish Startup for First Satellite Investment

author: Charlie Duxbury
description: Swedish prosecutors said they plan to appeal the acquittal of the government’s former national security advisor, Henrik Landerholm, over his alleged mishandling of sensitive documents.
title: Swedish Prosecutor Appeals Acquittal of Former Security Advisor

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin nominated the country’s top prosecutor to head the Supreme Court, elevating a loyalist sanctioned for prosecuting opposition leader Alexey Navalny and for other human rights violations.
title: Putin Elevates Navalny’s Prosecutor Krasnov to Lead Supreme Court

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany will borrow about a fifth more than planned in the fourth quarter to help fund a surge in spending on infrastructure and the armed forces.
title: Germany Lifts Debt Sales for Defense, Infrastructure Boost

author: Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul’s incoming administration is in talks with the central bank on measures to stabilize the baht, after the currency’s rally to a four-year high sparked calls for urgent intervention to protect exports and tourism.
title: New Thai Government Mulling Steps to Stabilize Baht, Ekniti Says

author: Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The highest US tariff among developed nations dealt a severe blow to Swiss exports, according to the first reading since the 39% levy took effect.
title: Swiss Exports to US Collapsed in First Month of 39% Tariff

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Philippine National Security Adviser Eduardo Año said China is “under pressure” to defend its territorial claims in the South China Sea following reports that at least two Chinese crew members died after a collision last month.
title: China Increased Aggression at Sea After Ship Mishap, Manila Says

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s top government spokesman Yoshimasa Hayashi vowed to ensure that real wages grow at a sustained pace of about 1% as part of a policy platform that he hopes will help him win the ruling party’s leadership race.
title: Japan LDP’s Hayashi Aims for Sustained 1% Real Wage Gains

author: Ditas B Lopez
description: The Philippines’ probe into the misuse of public funds for flood control projects could uncover trillions of pesos in losses, according to Public Works Secretary Vince Dizon, highlighting the extent of corruption that has fanned public outrage in the disaster-prone nation.
title: Philippine Losses From Flood Graft May Hit Trillions of Pesos

author: Erica Yokoyama, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Sanae Takaichi, a conservative hardliner known for supporting aggressive monetary easing and fiscal spending, declared her intention to run in the contest to become the next leader of Japan’s ruling Liberal Democratic Party.
title: Japan’s Pro-Stimulus Takaichi Announces LDP Race Candidacy

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Peru’s congress passed a bill late Wednesday allowing workers to withdraw billions from private pension funds, a major buyer of sovereign bonds.
title: Peru Congress Passes a New $7.5 Billion Pension Withdrawal Bill

author: Craig Stirling, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Too many of Europe’s leaders just can’t get stuff done anymore.
title: From UK to Poland, Europe Is Becoming the Ungovernable Continent

author: William Horobin, Ania Nussbaum
description: French unions are leading widespread anti-austerity protests Thursday, raising the pressure on newly appointed Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu as he struggles to find allies to piece together a budget.
title: French Protests Over Budget Raise Pressure on New Prime Minister

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump dined on organic Norfolk chicken at a white-tie banquet Wednesday night hosted by the British royal family. His state visit to the UK now turns to tougher diplomatic talks on trade and foreign policy with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.
title: Trump’s UK State Visit Shifts From Pomp to Politics and Investment

author: Philip Aldrick
description: UK taxpayers have lost £400 million ($547 million) on a startup investment rescue fund launched by former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak during the pandemic after hundreds of the companies went bust.
title: UK Taxpayers Lose £400 Million on Covid Startup Rescue Fund

author: Faris Mokhtar
description: The former general is targeting billionaires, sidelining political rivals and adding pressure on the central bank in his bid to reshape Indonesia’s economy
title: Prabowo Takes Aim at Indonesia Tycoons Following Deadly Unrest

author: Lucille Liu
description: Chinese Defense Minister Dong Jun opened Beijing’s flagship Xiangshan security forum on Thursday repeating a warning against “external interference” over Taiwan, while delivering a sharp critique of “bullying” in a veiled swipe at Washington.
title: China’s Defense Minister Warns on Taiwan, Condemns ‘Bullying’

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: China and South Korea’s top diplomats pledged to deepen their strategic partnership in their first meeting since Seoul’s leadership change earlier this year.
title: Top Envoys of China, South Korea Agree to Boost Strategic Ties

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump said he will formally designate antifa as a “MAJOR TERRORIST ORGANIZATION,” as the White House begins to fulfill its pledge to investigate what it calls left-wing extremism in the wake of the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Trump Says He’s Designating Antifa as a Terrorist Organization

author: Jon Herskovitz
description: Saudi Arabia and nuclear-armed Pakistan elevated their long-standing security partnership by signing a mutual defense pact, stating that “any aggression against either country shall be considered an aggression against both.”
title: Saudi Arabia and Pakistan Deepen Ties With Mutual Defense Pact
